intro: Aeschynomene tenuirama var. huillensis, commonly known as the Huillén Aeschynomene, is a perennial herb native to South America, particularly found in regions of Peru and Ecuador. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and ability to fix nitrogen in the soil. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and has trifoliate leaves with a smooth texture. Its small, pale yellow flowers are clustered in racemose inflorescences, and it produces slender, elongated pods containing small, round seeds. This species is of interest in ecological studies due to its role in local biodiversity and potential agricultural applications.
